title: Nio's stock tumbles toward record low after loss widens, sales fall and job cuts planned
text: Shares of Nio Inc. NIO, -18.75% tumbled 18% toward a record low in active premarket trading Monday, after the Shanghai-based electric car maker reported wider losses, declining revenue and said it plans to cut about 2,100 jobs, and cancelled its post-earnings conference call. Trading volume topped 2.4 million shares, making the stock the most actively traded ahead of the open. The net loss for the second quarter ended June 30 was RMB3.29 billion ($478.6 million), compared with a loss of RMB2.50 billion in the sequential first quarter and a loss of RMB1.81 billion a year ago. Vehicles sales fell 7.9% from the first quarter to RMB1.41 billion ($206.1 million), but rose from RMB44.4 million a year ago. Gross margin was negative 33.4%, after negative 13.4% in the first quarter. Deliveries totaled 837 vehicles in July and 1,943 vehicles in August. The company said it plans to cut its workforce to around 7,800 by the end of the third quarter from over 9,900 in January 2019. "In response to the overall tempered market conditions, we are also working hard to maximize returns on our resources and have implemented comprehensive efficiency and cost control measures across the organization," said Chief Executive William Bin Li. The stock, which is on track to open below its June 14 record low close of $2.42, has plunged 57.3% year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.31% has gained 19.3%.
